meanings.sent1: The angulate shape of the building made it look modern and sleek.
meanings.sent2: The angulate edges of the table could be dangerous if not handled carefully.
meanings.sent3: The angulate shadows cast by the streetlights created a unique pattern on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: Her angulate haircut gave her a bold and edgy look.
meanings.sent5: The angulate design of the logo made it stand out among the other brands.

meanings.definition: To form an angle or angles.
meanings.sent1: She tried to angulate the mirror to get a better view of the room.
meanings.sent2: The branches angulate upwards towards the sky.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to angulate his body in a way that would impress the judges.
meanings.sent4: The roads angulate sharply as they wind through the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's arms angulate gracefully as she moves across the stage.

meanings.sent1: The artist angulated the lines in the drawing to create a more dynamic composition.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter angulated the wood to fit perfectly into place.
meanings.sent3: She decided to angulate her handwriting to make it more legible.
meanings.sent4: The architect angulated the walls to give the building a modern look.
meanings.sent5: The chef angulated the vegetables on the plate for an artistic presentation.
